remarks: The intermediate value theorem, increasing case.  This is Metamath 100 proof #79.  (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jan-2008.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 30-Apr-2014.)
statement:
ivth.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. RR ) $.
ivth.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. RR ) $.
ivth.3 $e |- ( ph -> U e. RR ) $.
ivth.4 $e |- ( ph -> A < B ) $.
ivth.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( A [,] B ) C_ D ) $.
ivth.7 $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( D -cn-> CC ) ) $.
ivth.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( A [,] B ) ) -> ( F ` x ) e. RR ) $.
ivth.9 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( F ` A ) < U /\ U < ( F ` B ) ) ) $.
ivth $p |- ( ph -> E. c e. ( A (,) B ) ( F ` c ) = U ) $.
$d A c x $.
$d B c x $.
$d D c x $.
$d F c x $.
$d U c x $.
$d c ph x $.
